meanings.definition: Not satisfactory; not meeting expectations or needs.
meanings.sent1: The food at the restaurant was unsatisfactory, as it was cold and tasteless.
meanings.sent2: Her unsatisfactory performance in the exam disappointed her parents.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt to pull a rabbit out of a hat was unsatisfactory, as he ended up with a rubber chicken instead.
meanings.sent4: The student's effort to complete the project was unsatisfactory, like trying to build a sandcastle with wet sand.
meanings.sent5: The customer's experience at the store was unsatisfactory, leaving a bitter taste in their mouth.

meanings.definition: Failing to provide the desired or expected result.
meanings.sent1: The repair work on the car was unsatisfactory, as it broke down again after a week.
meanings.sent2: The unsatisfactory outcome of the negotiation left both parties unhappy.
meanings.sent3: The attempt to bake a cake without flour was unsatisfactory, resulting in a flat and tasteless dessert.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting was unsatisfactory, like a blank canvas with a single dot in the corner.
meanings.sent5: The team's unsatisfactory performance in the match cost them the championship title.
